law.catch_line: Advisory boards for protection and advocacy division -- Appointment -- Number -- Terms -- Compensation.

text.section: There shall be advisory boards for the Protection and Advocacy Division of the Department of Public Advocacy as set forth in Public Laws 99-319 and 106-402 and their implementing regulations. Each shall be comprised of not more than seventeen (17) citizen members appointed for terms of not less than two (2) years by the Protection and Advocacy Division director.
The advisory boards shall meet at least quarterly and on other occasions as may be necessary upon the call of the Protection and Advocacy Division director.

The members of the advisory boards shall receive no compensation for their services, but shall be reimbursed for all expenses incurred through the performance of their duties as members of their respective advisory board. No member of any board shall be held to be a public officer by reason of his or her membership on the board.

law.history: Amended 2002 Ky. Acts ch. 283, sec. 4, effective July 15, 2002. -- Created 1980 Ky. Acts ch. 295, sec. 9, effective July 15, 1980.
